Estimate contrasts

Source: R/estimate_contrasts.frequentist.R
estimate_contrasts.lm.Rd

Estimate contrasts

# S3 method for lm
estimate_contrasts(model, levels = NULL, fixed = NULL,
  modulate = NULL, transform = "none", length = 10,
  standardize = TRUE, standardize_robust = FALSE, ci = 0.95,
  adjust = "holm", ...)

Arguments

model

A Bayesian model.
levels

A character vector or formula specifying the names of the predictors over which to estimate means or contrasts.
fixed

A character vector indicating the names of the predictors to be "fixed" (i.e., maintained), so that the estimation is made at these values.
modulate

A character vector indicating the names of a numeric variable along which the means or the contrasts will be estimated. Adjust its length using length.
transform

Can be "none" (default for contrasts), "response" (default for means), "mu", "unlink", "log". "none" will leave the values on scale of the linear predictors. "response" will transform them on scale of the response variable. Thus for a logistic model, "none" will give estimations expressed in log-odds (probabilities on logit scale) and "response" in terms of probabilities.
length

Length of the spread numeric variables.
standardize

If TRUE, add standardized differences (Cohen's d) or coefficients.
standardize_robust

Robust standardization through MAD (Median Absolute Deviation, a robust estimate of SD) instead of regular SD.
ci

Confidence Interval (CI) level. Default to 0.95 (95%).
adjust

The p-values adjustment method for multi-comparisons. Can be one of "holm" (default), "tukey", "hochberg", "hommel", "bonferroni", "BH", "BY", "fdr" or "none". See the p-value adjustment section in the emmeans::test documentation.
...

Arguments passed to or from other methods.

Examples

library(estimate)

model <- lm(Sepal.Width ~ Species, data = iris)
estimate_contrasts(model)
#> Level1     |     Level2 | Difference |   SE |         95% CI |     t |  df |      p | Difference (std.)
#> -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#> setosa     | versicolor |       0.66 | 0.07 |   [0.49, 0.82] |  9.69 | 147 | < .001 |              1.51
#> setosa     |  virginica |       0.45 | 0.07 |   [0.29, 0.62] |  6.68 | 147 | < .001 |              1.04
#> versicolor |  virginica |      -0.20 | 0.07 | [-0.37, -0.04] | -3.00 | 147 |  < .01 |             -0.47

model <- lm(Sepal.Width ~ Species * Petal.Width, data = iris)
estimate_contrasts(model)
#> NOTE: Results may be misleading due to involvement in interactions
#> Level1     |     Level2 | Difference |   SE |        95% CI |    t |  df |      p | Difference (std.)
#> -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#> setosa     | versicolor |       1.59 | 0.39 |  [0.64, 2.54] | 4.04 | 144 | < .001 |              3.65
#> setosa     |  virginica |       1.77 | 0.41 |  [0.77, 2.78] | 4.29 | 144 | < .001 |              4.07
#> versicolor |  virginica |       0.18 | 0.15 | [-0.17, 0.54] | 1.27 | 144 |   > .1 |              0.42
estimate_contrasts(model, fixed = "Petal.Width")
#> Level1     |     Level2 | Petal.Width | Difference |   SE |        95% CI |    t |  df |      p | Difference (std.)
#> -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#> setosa     | versicolor |        1.20 |       1.59 | 0.39 |  [0.64, 2.54] | 4.04 | 144 | < .001 |              3.65
#> setosa     |  virginica |        1.20 |       1.77 | 0.41 |  [0.77, 2.78] | 4.29 | 144 | < .001 |              4.07
#> versicolor |  virginica |        1.20 |       0.18 | 0.15 | [-0.17, 0.54] | 1.27 | 144 |   > .1 |              0.42
estimate_contrasts(model, modulate = "Petal.Width", length = 4)
#> Level1     |     Level2 | Petal.Width | Difference |   SE |        95% CI |     t |  df |      p | Difference (std.)
#> --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#> setosa     | versicolor |        0.10 |       1.83 | 0.28 |  [1.15, 2.50] |  6.55 | 144 | < .001 |              4.19
#> setosa     | versicolor |        0.90 |       1.65 | 0.29 |  [0.96, 2.35] |  5.74 | 144 | < .001 |              3.80
#> setosa     | versicolor |        1.70 |       1.48 | 0.60 |  [0.03, 2.94] |  2.47 | 144 |  < .05 |              3.40
#> setosa     | versicolor |        2.50 |       1.31 | 0.95 | [-1.00, 3.62] |  1.37 | 144 |   > .1 |              3.00
#> setosa     |  virginica |        0.10 |       1.55 | 0.31 |  [0.79, 2.30] |  4.95 | 144 | < .001 |              3.55
#> setosa     |  virginica |        0.90 |       1.71 | 0.32 |  [0.93, 2.50] |  5.28 | 144 | < .001 |              3.93
#> setosa     |  virginica |        1.70 |       1.88 | 0.60 |  [0.43, 3.32] |  3.14 | 144 |  < .01 |              4.31
#> setosa     |  virginica |        2.50 |       2.04 | 0.92 | [-0.19, 4.28] |  2.21 | 144 |   0.06 |              4.68
#> versicolor |  virginica |        0.10 |      -0.28 | 0.41 | [-1.26, 0.70] | -0.69 | 144 |   > .1 |             -0.64
#> versicolor |  virginica |        0.90 |       0.06 | 0.21 | [-0.44, 0.56] |  0.28 | 144 |   > .1 |              0.13
#> versicolor |  virginica |        1.70 |       0.40 | 0.11 |  [0.12, 0.67] |  3.50 | 144 |  < .01 |              0.91
#> versicolor |  virginica |        2.50 |       0.73 | 0.27 |  [0.08, 1.39] |  2.70 | 144 |  < .05 |              1.68
# NOT RUN {
library(lme4)

data <- iris
data$Petal.Length_factor <- ifelse(data$Petal.Length < 4.2, "A", "B")

model <- lmer(Sepal.Width ~ Species + (1 | Petal.Length_factor), data = data)
estimate_contrasts(model)
# }
